intro: Miconia glanduliflora, commonly known as the Brazilian angel's trumpets, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to South America. It is characterized by its large, showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in glandular hairs. It is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. Miconia glanduliflora is known for its rapid growth and can become invasive in certain environments.
